short_description: This function trains a interpolation weight model based on weighted collaborative filtering approach.
long_description: This function trains a interpolation weight model based on weighted collaborative filtering approach.

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.rDescription: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queen’s IP address or hostname.
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queen’s IP address or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the database where the input table is located.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.rDescription: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.rDescription: The Aster Database password of the user.
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.rDescription: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.rDescription: The password for the SSL truststore.
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: WeightModelTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Name for the output table containing the interpolation weights
argument_clauses.description: Name for the output table containing the interpolation weights

argument_clauses.name: BiasModelTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Name for the output table containing the global, user, and item bias statistics.
argument_clauses.description: Name for the output table containing the global, user, and item bias statistics.

argument_clauses.name: NearestItemsTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Name for the output table containing the nearest neighbors for each item. If this argument is not present, the NearestNeighbors table is not produced, If the argument is used, and a table with the specified name exists, the function uses the existing table to train the model, If the argument is used and no table with the specified name exists, the function creates a table with the specified name.
argument_clauses.description: Name for the output table containing the nearest neighbors for each item. If this argument is not present, the NearestNeighbors table is not produced, If the argument is used, and a table with the specified name exists, the function uses the existing table to train the model, If the argument is used and no table with the specified name exists, the function creates a table with the specified name.

argument_clauses.name: UserIdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The user id column in the rating table. The default is the first column in the rating table.
argument_clauses.description: The user id column in the rating table. The default is the first column in the rating table.

argument_clauses.name: ItemIdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The item id column in the rating table. The default is the second column in the rating table.
argument_clauses.description: The item id column in the rating table. The default is the second column in the rating table.

argument_clauses.name: RatingColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The rating column in the rating table. The default is the third column in the rating table.
argument_clauses.description: The rating column in the rating table. The default is the third column in the rating table.

argument_clauses.name: LearningRate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Initial learning rate. The learning rate adjusts automatically during training based on changes in the rmse. Default is 0.001.
argument_clauses.description: Initial learning rate. The learning rate adjusts automatically during training based on changes in the rmse. Default is 0.001.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Maximum number of iterations. Default is 10
argument_clauses.description: Maximum number of iterations. Default is 10

argument_clauses.name: K
argument_clauses.rDescription: The number of nearest neighbors used in the calculation of the interpolation weights. Default is 20.
argument_clauses.description: The number of nearest neighbors used in the calculation of the interpolation weights. Default is 20.

argument_clauses.name: Threshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: The function stops when the rmse drops below this level. Default is 0.0002.
argument_clauses.description: The function stops when the rmse drops below this level. Default is 0.0002.

argument_clauses.name: ItemSimilarity
argument_clauses.rDescription: The method used to calculate item similarity. The default is the Pearson correlation coefficient. Options include: Pearson (Pearson correlation coefficient), adjustedcosine (adjusted cosine similarity)
argument_clauses.description: The method used to calculate item similarity. The default is the Pearson correlation coefficient. Options include: Pearson (Pearson correlation coefficient), adjustedcosine (adjusted cosine similarity)
